cmabreu.sagitarii.sdk

Class Wrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • cmabreu.sagitarii.sdk.Wrapper

  • public class Wrapper
extends Object
    This class is the Wrapper engine. The Wrapper engine encapsulates all complex Sagitarii-related stuffs so you can concentrate in you own job.
    Author:
    Carlos Magno O. Abreu : magno.mabreu@gmail.com

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wrapper

        public Wrapper(String wrapperAlias,
       String workFolder,
       String wrapperFolder,
       IWrapperProcessor processor)
        throws Exception
        Constructor. You must pass an alias short name ( 15 characters length ) to this wrapper. The workFolder and wrapperFolder are the same passed at args[0] and args[1] from Teapot to your wrapper class. Processor is your own implementation of IWrapperProcessor. processLine() will be called line by line when you call process()
        Throws:
        Exception

    • Method Detail

      • getWrapperFolder

        public String getWrapperFolder()
        The wrapper folder

      • process

        public void process()
             throws Exception
        Execute the IWrapperProcessor implementation and pass the input CSV line by line (with header) to it. To get some data, use: String myData = record.get("your_column_name"); Don't forget to save your output data to the output List. Your processor MUST implement a List to hold the output data. When you call save(), this class will call getOutputData() from your processor to get the data to send to Sagitarii.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • save

        public void save()
          throws Exception
        Save the output data. This data must be provided by the Wrapper processor.
        Throws:
        Exception
